meanings.definition: Staggier (comparative of 'stagger'): Moving unsteadily from side to side.
meanings.sent1: The man looked staggier as he tried to walk in a straight line.
meanings.sent2: The cat's staggier movements showed it was not feeling well.
meanings.sent3: The staggier dance moves of the penguin made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The staggier progress of the snail was still faster than expected.
meanings.sent5: The staggier boat ride left everyone feeling queasy.

meanings.definition: Staggier (comparative of 'stagger'): Having a greater difference in height or level.
meanings.sent1: The staggier steps of the staircase made it harder to climb.
meanings.sent2: The mountain range had staggier peaks than the hills nearby.
meanings.sent3: The staggier seesaw made it challenging for the kids to play.
meanings.sent4: The staggier buildings in the city created a unique skyline.
meanings.sent5: The staggier waves crashed against the shore with great force.
